image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a hoodie and bowler hat in a park

props.synopsis: Former Alice Springs Coles worker Gene Hill says it was clear an Aboriginal man who died in police custody at the supermarket last week had a disability and needed extra support.

title.children: Former Coles supermarket worker says Kumanjayi White clearly needed support

image.altText: Close up of a phone with SpaceX connectivity

props.synopsis: An Australia-first service using satellites to deliver text messages anywhere in the country promises to provide service to those living in mobile black spots.

title.children: Direct to satellite text messaging service gets first Australian users

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and glasses leans down to talk to an Indigenous person.

props.synopsis: The long-awaited coronial findings into the 2019 death in custody of Aboriginal man Kumanjayi Walker will be delayed by a month, after the death of another Warlpiri man in Alice Springs last week.

title.children: Kumanjayi Walker inquest findings delayed after death in custody

image.altText: Man in a blue shirt is interviewed for TV

props.synopsis: Dennis Naroldol has pleaded guilty to manslaughter after stabbing his partner through the heart outside the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel on the Darwin Esplanade in 2023.

title.children: Man who fatally stabbed partner outside NT hotel pleads guilty to manslaughter

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old woman has died at Royal Darwin Hospital 10 days after an alleged domestic violence attack. A man has been charged as police continue to investigate.

title.children: 22yo woman dies in Darwin hospital after alleged domestic violence attack

image.altText: A man with a beanie and goatee holding a bass guitar

props.synopsis: Since first picking up a guitar as a teenager, James Mangohig has gone on to collaborate with stars like Jessica Mauboy and win an ARIA award with fellow Northern Territory artist Emily Wurramara.

title.children: Darwin's 'melting pot' key to success for award-winning music producer

image.altText: A man's eye illuminated by a light.

props.synopsis: In the Top End, cataracts often go untreated for years, becoming dense and leathery. A roving surgery team is tackling the backlog and restoring sight to remote Indigenous patients.

title.children: Life-changing cataract surgery restores eyesight to hunt again

props.synopsis: Australians are losing millions of dollars each year to scams involving cash deposits at cryptocurrency ATMs — machines authorities warn are increasingly being exploited by criminals for money laundering. The rapid rise of crypto ATMs has outpaced regulation, creating opportunities for criminal misuse.

title.children: Older Australians are losing millions in scams involving crypto ATMs

image.altText: A group of men and women in conversation as they descend a flight of stairs

props.synopsis: The talks come after one of Ukraine's most ambitious attacks of the war saw Kyiv target Russian nuclear-capable long-range bombers.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine agree prisoner swap but no ceasefire after talks

image.altText: Joanna Pascua

props.synopsis: Joanna Pascua wins the right to Australian workplace protections despite living almost 6,000 kilometres away. Lawyers say she paved the way for legal claims, including class actions, against employers by "exploited" offshore workers.

title.children: Filipino woman changes the game for Australia's 'exploited' offshore workers

image.altText: A illustration shows two plate-shaped galaxies approaching each other.

props.synopsis: A new study challenges predictions our home galaxy the Milky Way will crash into the Andromeda galaxy in 5 billion years.

title.children: Andromeda may not crash into the Milky Way, but another galaxy probably will

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt is photographed outdoors with soft sunlight and greenery in the background.

props.synopsis: SA fashion entrepreneur Carol Foord turned to alternative treatments before her death. A year on her family is still seeking answers about how her final hours played out.

title.children: An Adelaide fashion icon died after using magic mushrooms. Her family wants answers

image.altText: A woman having a cosmetic injectible in her lip.

props.synopsis: The Australian health practitioner regulator introduces sweeping new guidelines for dentists and nurses performing non-surgical cosmetic injectable procedures, in a bid to better protect consumers.

title.children: Crackdown on cosmetic injectables industry putting profit before patients

image.altText: A man with greying hair and a large bandage over his right ear emotionless in a police mugshot

props.synopsis: FBI documents allege Mohamed Sabry Soliman used a makeshift flamethrower and threw Molotov cocktails at a pro-Israel group in an attack he says he planned for more than a year.

title.children: Colorado terror attack suspect charged with hate crime

image.altText: a man in a black puffer jacket stands among knee-high desiccated crops

props.synopsis: With this year's winter grain crop planted, ABARES estimates drought and dry conditions in SA, Victoria and NSW will see lower harvest totals this summer.

title.children: Drought delivers 8 per cent cut to grain production estimates

image.altText: Cloud plumes coming from a volcano.

props.synopsis: Mount Etna, an active volcano on the east coast of Sicily, erupted on Monday, sending tourists on the mountain running for safety.

title.children: Mount Etna suddenly erupts, sending tourists fleeing for safety

image.altText: A low angle pic of public housing towers in front of a blue sky

props.synopsis: New research shows demand for social housing has grown at the same time as the number of people helped into homes slowed around the country.

title.children: Report questions how Australia can tackle need for public housing stock

image.altText: Emily Chamberlain

props.synopsis: A new initiative from a Queensland hospital hopes to bring an end to weight discrimination in maternity care.

title.children: Pregnant women left 'crying and exhausted' after questions over weight

image.altText: Children stand behind a sign that reads "Stop war".

props.synopsis: After Israel resumed its bombardment of Gaza, Palestinians took to the streets to protest against Hamas – and some are willing to keep speaking out even if it means violent reprisals.

title.children: Executions and reprisals: Hamas taking action as protests occur in Gaza

image.altText: Dorinda Cox Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Dorinda Cox, who was the Greens' only Indigenous representative in the federal parliament, has left the party.

title.children: Greens senator defects to Labor

image.altText: Two players in green and gold celebrate a goal.

props.synopsis: Incoming coach Joe Montemurro watched on as the Matildas farewell interim coach Tom Sermanni against Argentina in Canberra.

title.children: Matildas hit four to down Argentina in front of new coach

image.altText: Close up of a phone with SpaceX connectivity

props.synopsis: An Australia-first service using satellites to deliver text messages anywhere in the country promises to provide service to those living in mobile black spots.

title.children: Direct to satellite text messaging service gets first Australian users

image.altText: a chemist testing a drug sample

props.synopsis: Documents show the evaluation, which was due to be handed to the state government late last week, cost taxpayers $453,286.

title.children: Taxpayer-funded review of drug testing in Queensland may not be released

image.altText: Indigenous woman standing at fence

props.synopsis: When Kelly Anderson suddenly lost her daughter, she became depressed and rapidly gained weight. A community exercise program helped turn her life around.

title.children: The diabetes program lifting people out a 'really dark place'

image.altText: An elderly woman in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Laila Soueif's family says the 69-year-old is close to death after the lengthy hunger strike in protest of her son's detention.

title.children: Jailed activist 'worried' for mother hospitalised after 242-day hunger strike

image.altText: A composite image of three people sitting in a studio. They are all looking at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Doctors and nurses see people in crisis being turned away, patients discharged before it is safe, and interminable wait times boil over into life-threatening violence.

title.children: A health system in crisis, and the workers who won't stay silent

image.altText: Back of male police officer with  car

props.synopsis: NSW Police are treating the discovery of a man's body at a property at Croydon Park as a homicide, describing the man's injuries as "horrific".

title.children: Man's body found with stab wounds, police believe is 'drug deal gone horribly wrong'

image.altText: A drone hovers above a trucks trailer with a plume of smoke in the background.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's security services say they have destroyed 34 per cent of Russia's air missile carriers with a bold drone attack. Here's what we know.

title.children: How Ukraine pulled off its 'extremely complex' drone attack on Russia

image.altText: Beef being cooked on a flaming grill.

props.synopsis: One of the biggest holidays on the Islamic calendar is happening on Friday. Here's how it's different to a feasting day with a similar name structure.

title.children: Eid al-Adha falls on a Friday this year. It could mean a lot of barbecues on the weekend

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell holds out his hands

props.synopsis: The toll of repeated injuries forces Glenn Maxwell to draw the curtains on a phenomenal one day career which featured two World Cup wins for Australia.

title.children: 'I felt like I was letting the team down': Maxwell makes selfless retirement call

image.altText: two side by side images showing a paraglider wearing a white helmet, then a black one.

props.synopsis: The ABC was among hundreds of media outlets which reported on the incredible footage. Experts say the video was at least partially manipulated by artificial intelligence.

title.children: A close look at this viral Chinese video reveals something is off

image.altText: A subdivision under construction in southern Tasmania

props.synopsis: Developers in Tasmania can apply for a rebate to offset some of the costs associated with subdivisions. It's part of a program aimed at fast-tracking lots for "affordable" sales but, after 10 months not one affordable lot has been sold.

title.children: Tasmanian land program yet to deliver affordable lots for homes

image.altText: A teenage nfl flag player holds a ball in one hand pointing it at the camera on a sports field on the Sunshine Coast

props.synopsis: Amercia's NFL Flag Football is rapidly growing in popularity worldwide and has invested heavily in the Australian market.

title.children: American giant's quest to become a top-three Australian sport

image.altText: Modern open-plan office with computers, plants and natural light

props.synopsis: Hot-desking has become the new normal in workplaces across the country, but experts say our office etiquette doesn't always reflect how commonplace open-plan offices have become.

title.children: How often do you need to be in the office to claim a desk?
